definitions: of only moderate quality that lacks distinction or excellence
examples: The restaurant served mediocre food at premium prices
His mediocre performance disappointed the entire team

definitions: involving or engaged in deep thought or contemplation of spiritual matters
designed to encourage quiet reflection and mental stillness
examples: She sat in meditative silence by the lake
The garden had a meditative quality that calmed visitors
The teacher played meditative music during yoga class
His meditative practices helped reduce daily stress

definitions: quiet, gentle, and easily imposed on without protest
examples: The meek student rarely spoke up in class
Her meek demeanor masked a strong inner resolve

definitions: relating to or denoting prehistoric monuments made of or containing large stones
examples: The megalithic structures at Stonehenge attract millions of visitors
Archaeologists discovered a new megalithic burial site

definitions: feeling or expressing a pensive sadness with no obvious cause
examples: The melancholic music matched her somber mood perfectly
He had a melancholic temperament that colored his artwork

definitions: feeling or showing a pensive sadness that seems without cause
causing or tending to cause sadness or depression of mind
examples: She felt melancholy on rainy autumn afternoons
His melancholy expression worried his close friends
The melancholy tune brought tears to many eyes
The abandoned house had a melancholy atmosphere

definitions: pleasantly smooth or soft through age or ripeness
relaxed and good-humored through maturity or experience
examples: The mellow flavor of aged whiskey pleased connoisseurs
The mellow light of sunset bathed the landscape
He became more mellow as he grew older
The mellow jazz created a relaxed atmosphere

definitions: relating to or having a pleasant sequence of musical notes
examples: The melodic bird songs filled the morning air
She composed melodic tunes that everyone could hum

definitions: pleasant-sounding with a smooth flowing musical quality
examples: Her melodious voice captivated the entire audience
The melodious chimes rang throughout the garden

definitions: exaggerated and emotional in a way that seems insincere
examples: His melodramatic reaction to criticism annoyed everyone
The movie's melodramatic plot twists strained credibility

definitions: changed from solid to liquid state through heating
made tender or gentle through emotional warmth
examples: The melted chocolate dripped onto the counter
The melted snow formed puddles on the sidewalk
Her heart melted when she saw the puppy
His melted resistance finally gave way to agreement

definitions: in the process of changing from solid to liquid
causing feelings of tenderness or sympathy
examples: The melting ice cream needed immediate attention
The melting snow signaled spring's arrival
Her melting smile disarmed all his anger
The melting scene brought tears to viewers

definitions: having a specified number or type of limbs or members
examples: The four-membered committee met every Tuesday morning
The six-membered ring structure is common in chemistry

definitions: resembling or consisting of a thin flexible layer of tissue
examples: The membranous wings of the dragonfly shimmered beautifully
Doctors examined the membranous lining of the organ

definitions: worth remembering or easily remembered due to special qualities
examples: Their memorable wedding featured fireworks and live music
She gave a memorable speech that inspired everyone

definitions: suggesting the presence of danger or threatening harm
examples: The menacing storm clouds gathered on the horizon
His menacing glare made everyone step back nervously

definitions: not requiring much skill and lacking prestige or importance
examples: She grew tired of menial tasks at work
The menial chores took up most of his day

definitions: relating to or characteristic of the period ending menstruation
examples: The doctor discussed menopausal symptoms with her patient
Menopausal changes affect women differently

definitions: relating to the process of menstruation or monthly periods
examples: She tracked her menstrual cycle on a calendar
The menstrual cramps caused her significant discomfort

definitions: relating to trade or commerce especially on a large scale
examples: The mercantile district bustled with commercial activity
His mercantile ventures expanded across three continents

definitions: primarily concerned with making money at the expense of ethics
examples: His mercenary attitude alienated potential business partners
The mercenary soldiers fought for whoever paid most

definitions: showing or exercising mercy and compassion toward those in distress
examples: The merciful judge reduced the harsh sentence
She was merciful to those who wronged her

definitions: showing no mercy or pity in treatment of others
examples: The merciless sun beat down on desert travelers
His merciless criticism destroyed her self-confidence completely

definitions: subject to sudden or unpredictable changes of mood or mind
examples: Her mercurial temperament made relationships difficult
The mercurial weather changed from sunshine to storms

definitions: combined or united to form a single entity
examples: The merged companies created a powerful business empire
The merged lanes caused traffic to slow considerably

definitions: in the process of combining or uniting into one
examples: The merging traffic required careful attention from drivers
Merging departments created confusion among staff members

definitions: relating to or situated at the highest point of development
examples: The empire reached its meridian power before declining
Her meridian achievements came in her forties

definitions: deserved or earned as a result of actions or qualities
examples: His merited promotion came after years of dedication
The team's merited victory crowned a perfect season

definitions: deserving reward or praise for excellence or worthy actions
examples: Her meritorious service earned national recognition
The meritorious students received special scholarships

definitions: cheerful and lively in mood or manner
examples: The merry children sang songs around the campfire
His merry disposition brightened everyone's day

definitions: caught or engaged together like gears or netting
examples: The meshed gears operated the complex machinery smoothly
Their meshed schedules made planning meetings difficult

definitions: held spellbound by fascination as if by hypnotic power
examples: The audience sat mesmerized by the magician's performance
She stood mesmerized by the northern lights display

definitions: capturing complete attention in a way that seems magical
examples: The mesmerizing dance performance earned standing ovations
His mesmerizing storytelling kept children enthralled for hours

definitions: relating to the middle period of the stone age
examples: The mesolithic tools showed advanced crafting techniques
Mesolithic hunter-gatherers left fascinating archaeological remains

definitions: relating to or resembling a messiah or inspired leader
examples: His messianic complex made him believe he could save everyone
The messianic prophecies influenced religious movements

definitions: untidy or dirty in appearance or habits
complicated and likely to cause problems or controversy
examples: The messy room needed hours of cleaning
Her messy desk reflected her chaotic work style
The messy divorce dragged on for two years
It was a messy situation with no easy solution

definitions: relating to the chemical processes maintaining life in organisms
examples: Regular exercise improves metabolic health significantly
The metabolic disorder required careful dietary management

definitions: consisting of or resembling metal in appearance or properties
having a harsh quality suggestive of metal
examples: The metallic paint gave the car a futuristic appearance
The metallic surface reflected light brilliantly
The medicine left a metallic taste in her mouth
His metallic voice grated on everyone's nerves

definitions: relating to the science of extracting and working with metals
examples: The metallurgical engineer designed new alloy compositions
Metallurgical analysis revealed the sword's ancient origins

definitions: relating to rock transformed by heat, pressure, or other processes
examples: The metamorphic rocks showed beautiful crystalline patterns
Geologists studied the metamorphic formations in detail

definitions: characteristic of or relating to metaphor as figurative language
examples: His metaphoric language painted vivid mental pictures
The poet's metaphoric style influenced modern writers

definitions: used in a figurative way to represent something else symbolically
examples: The metaphorical journey represented personal growth
Her metaphorical wings gave her freedom to explore

definitions: relating to the branch of philosophy dealing with existence and reality beyond the physical
examples: The metaphysical questions puzzled philosophers for centuries
His metaphysical poetry explored themes of existence

definitions: relating to the spread of disease from one organ to another
examples: The metastatic cancer required aggressive treatment immediately
Doctors monitored for metastatic growth in other organs

definitions: resembling a meteor in speed or brilliance of development
examples: Her meteoric rise to fame surprised industry veterans
The company's meteoric growth attracted investor attention

definitions: relating to the processes and phenomena of the atmosphere and weather
examples: The meteorological data predicted severe storms approaching
Meteorological conditions made flying dangerous today

definitions: done according to a systematic or established procedure
examples: Her methodical approach ensured nothing was overlooked
The methodical investigation uncovered important evidence

definitions: relating to the system of methods used in research or study
examples: The methodological flaws undermined the research conclusions
They followed strict methodological guidelines throughout

definitions: having undergone methylation by adding a methyl group
examples: The methylated compounds showed different chemical properties
Methylated spirits served as an effective cleaning agent

definitions: showing great attention to detail and being very careful and precise
examples: His meticulous record-keeping saved the company during audits
She was meticulous about grammar in her writing
